channel.title: Kde 4
channel.description: Hi all, Should I bother upgrading to KDE 4? It looks half decent, but I was listening to LugRadio (A Linux Podcast) and they said it was lacking a lot of usability. Well, what do you think?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 30, 2008, 10:18:08 PM[/size][hr]I guess the Linux section really is dead ;(

item.description:
@tL wrote:

I was actually going to install it in a few months time after its been used for a while, bugs found and fixed and other problems like that. But i suppose i’ll try it later when i can be bothered.

Read full topic

item.title: Kde 4
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

There really isn’t a need to flat out upgrade to KDE4 when you can install it and try it right beside your KDE3 installation. The instructions for kubuntu are here: http://kubuntu.org/announcements/kde-4.0.php

Now as far as my experience with it, I can’t say I care for it that much, but I have only used it for a few minutes so have not unleashed all the features I am sure. Also remember that KDE 3.5 has been under active development and many iterations for years, and KDE4 has just started off, so I do expect great things in the near future.

Read full topic
